page.title: 03MYERS GROVE CONSERVATION.
page.content: This is led by Mr S.Byers.The sponsor is Bassets Sweets.The 1985 work has included repairing footpaths on an old landscaped coal tip at Wombwell and near to school tree planting,digging a pond and litter collection.Projects included testing for Acid Rain on the school roof.The rain was not very acid.Pupils can gain awards for active conservation work.The work is recorded in the schools Conservation Action Newsletter.In May an Environment Week was held in school to make pupils aware of conservation,with talks,slide shows,films.Preservation work on old industrial steam and diesel locomotives took place at the South Yorkshire Railway Preservation Society led by Mr R.M.Hallatt.The school has a Wildlife Club.Elm trees resistant to Dutch Elm Disease have been planted.
